description: Manifest describing group of [Docker containers](http://docker.io); also used by [Google Cloud Platform's container-vm images](https://developers.google.com/compute/docs/containers).

___containers.description: The list of containers to launch.

___name.description: A symbolic name used to create and track the container. Must be an RFC1035 compatible value (a single segment of a DNS name). All containers must have unique names.

___volumeMounts.description: Data volumes to expose into the container.

___name.description: The name of the volume to mount. This must match the name of a volume defined in volumes[].

___mountPath.description: The path at which to mount the volume inside the container. This must be an absolute path and no longer than 512 characters.

___readOnly.description: Whether this volume should be read-only. Default is false (read-write).

___command.description: The command line to run. If this is omitted, the container is assumed to have a command embedded in it.

___ports.description: Ports to expose from the container. All of these are exposed out through the public interface of the VM.

___name.description: A symbolic name used to create and track the port. Must be an RFC1035 compatible value (a single segment of a DNS name).

___hostPort.description: The port on the host which maps to the containerPort. Default is auto-allocated.

___containerPort.description: The port on which the container is listening.

___protocol.description: The protocol for this port. Valid options are TCP and UDP. Default is TCP.

___env.description: Environment variables to set before the container runs.

___name.description: The name of the environment variable.

___value.description: The value of the environment variable.

___workingDir.description: The initial working directory for the command. Default is the container’s embedded working directory or else the Docker default.

___volumes.description: A list of volumes to share between containers.

___name.description: The name of the volume. Must be an RFC1035 compatible value (a single segment of a DNS name). All volumes must have unique names. These are referenced by `containers[].volumeMounts[].name`.
